content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– • Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) serving as the factory interface  
– • Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed using direction RIGHT  
– • Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) connected as a production neighbour

### Depot Belt Network at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– • Wooden Chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot  
– • Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the depot chest  
– • Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) placed with direction UP adjacent to the chest

### Electricity Generator at position (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– • Steam Engine (Generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)  
– • Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)  
– • Offshore Pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)


ERROR TIPS

– When connecting transport belts, avoid selecting a Prototype.SteamEngine as the target. Instead, add and use an inserter that inputs items into the steam engine to ensure proper belt connection.
– Before placing an entity, verify that the target position is within the allowed range relative to the player’s current location to prevent placement distance errors.
– Confirm that the required inventory items (for example, a wooden chest) are available prior to attempting placement.
– Ensure that all variables (such as one used for target chest assignment) are defined before reference, to prevent NameError issues.
